meanings.definition: Lacking flavor or zest; not tasty
meanings.sent1: The soup was the insipidest dish I had ever tasted.
meanings.sent2: The plain rice was the insipidest food at the party.
meanings.sent3: The insipidest sandwich in the cafeteria made me appreciate my homemade lunch.
meanings.sent4: Her insipidest attempt at cooking left everyone craving for more flavor.
meanings.sent5: The insipidest apple I bit into was like eating cardboard.

meanings.definition: Lacking in qualities that excite, stimulate, or interest; dull
meanings.sent1: The movie was the insipidest film I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: His insipidest joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The insipidest lecture put me to sleep within minutes.
meanings.sent4: The insipidest conversation at the party made me want to leave early.
meanings.sent5: Her insipidest story was like listening to paint dry.
